result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Branda Saree Kolve

records.addlTxt: Filed by ADA Becker. arc   e: Atty Firkus

9:20 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Branda Saree Kolve in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Branda Saree Kolve.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews file. Atty Firkus states an offer was received, but discovery has not been sent at this time, plans to pick it up after this hearing, hoping to set this for PH or PLEAS to review file.  DE verified address and phone number.  Bond continues. Adjourned at 9:22 AM. bph
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Order for payment on October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
The original document was titled: Pretrial Assessment Report (sealed)
The original history event date is: 08-30-2022
Pretrial Assessment Report. Reviewed by SRN. SEALED w/ access to parties.  gll

Defendant must submit baseline test prior to release from custody. 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug and ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

2:01 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Michael Becker appeared.  Jeremiah Harrelson appeared for Defendant for today. Defendant Branda Saree Kolve in court, in custody. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given.  DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered. Waive speedy prelim. Court sets PSC.  gll
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
